title: Use distributive property
text: Use distributive property to rewrite the expression $$\frac{10x^2+5x-4}{\left(-5x\right)}=\frac{10x^2}{\left(-5x\right)}+\frac{5x}{\left(-5x\right)}+\frac{\left(-4\right)}{\left(-5x\right)}$$
speech: Use distributive property to rewrite the expression  fraction, 10 x squared, plus 5 x minus 4, over, negative 5 x,  is equal to fraction, 10 x squared, over, negative 5 x,  plus fraction, 5 x, over, negative 5 x,  plus, fraction, negative 4, over, negative 5 x,
pacedSpeech: Use distributive property to rewrite the expression  this expression

title: Use distributive property
text: As a reminder, the distributive law states $$\left(a+b+d\right) c=a c+b c+d c$$
speech: As a reminder, the distributive law states  parentheses, a plus b plus d,  times c is equal to a c plus b c plus d c
pacedSpeech: As a reminder, the distributive law states   , a plus b plus d,  times c is equal to a c plus b c plus d c

title: Use distributive property
text: in this case, we can see divided by $$\left(-5x\right)$$ same as multiply by $$\frac{1}{\left(-5x\right)}$$, $$a=10x^2$$ , $$b=5x$$, $$d=$$ $$-4$$, $$c=\frac{1}{\left(-5x\right)}$$
speech: in this case, we can see divided by  negative 5 x,  same as multiply by , fraction, 1 over, negative 5 x,  ,  a is equal to, 10 x squared,  ,  b is equal to, 5 x ,  d, is equal to,   negative 4 ,  c is equal to, fraction, 1 over, negative 5 x,

title: Simplify each term in expression

title: Simplify each term in expression

title: Simplify $$\frac{\left(-4\right)}{\left(-5x\right)}$$
text: the only common factor in both numerator and denominator is $$-1$$, so the only thing we can do to simplify this term is divided both numerator and denominator by $$-1$$
speech: the only common factor in both numerator and denominator is  minus 1 , so the only thing we can do to simplify this term is divided both numerator and denominator by  negative 1
pacedSpeech: the only common factor in both numerator and denominator is   minus 1
, so the only thing we can do to simplify this term is divided both numerator and denominator by   negative 1

title: Combine the simplified terms
text: As our last step, we can put the simplified terms back to the expression $$\frac{10x^2}{\left(-5x\right)}+\frac{5x}{\left(-5x\right)}+\frac{\left(-4\right)}{\left(-5x\right)}$$

subHints.title: Combine the simplified terms
subHints.text: in the expression $$\frac{10x^2}{\left(-5x\right)}+\frac{5x}{\left(-5x\right)}+\frac{\left(-4\right)}{\left(-5x\right)}$$, replace $$\frac{10x^2}{\left(-5x\right)}$$ with $$-2x$$, replace $$\frac{\left(-4\right)}{\left(-5x\right)}$$ with $$\frac{4}{5x}$$, and replace $$\frac{5x}{\left(-5x\right)}$$ with $$-1$$, then we yield a new expression
